questions.text: Which villain was thought to have hospitalized 5 people despite being locked up in the DEO?
questions.explanation:
Livewire.

	"I get out of here, you're all going to pay", she told Lucy Lane. Who caused the accidents was one of the mysteries of the episode. She was later broken out of containment by Siobhan.

questions.text: What did Cat use as a metaphor for Kara's love life?
questions.explanation:
A box of cupcakes.

	She advised Kara to act fast before "they" were all gone. She also told Kara to make herself unavailable to seem more desirable.

questions.text: Siobhan returned to the CatCo offices and attacked which employee?
questions.explanation:
Kara.

	When she fell out of the window she was saved by The Flash, who made his first appearance in the series.  She flew away from him as he was talking to her. Neither knew who the other was because they were from different dimensions.

questions.text: The Flash revealed his identity to Supergirl within minutes of meeting her.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After a brief conversation when she didn't know any of the heroes on "The Flash", "Arrow", or "Heroes of Tomorrow" he revealed his identity to her. At that point he didn't know her real identity yet. His identity, when not fighting crime, was Barry Allen.

questions.text: While explaining his powers to Supergirl's friends, Barry got them all ice cream. What flavor was it?
questions.explanation:
Vanilla.

	Barry explained that he had never accidentally travelled through a different dimension before. After also telling them that he need's to consume 10,000 calories a day Kara offered to take him for doughnuts.

questions.text: What did Cat name the "new" superhero?
questions.explanation:
The Blur.

	It was a joke by the writers because that was what Superman was known by in "Smallville" for a time. Cat told Barry and the others that The Flash sounded like someone who hid in alleys and jumped out at people.

questions.text: What was the source of Siobhan's powers?
options: Transferred to her when she came through a dimensional portal
questions.explanation:
A Banshee.

	Her aunt explained to her that the family curse is to take on the powers of the Banshee when they are wronged. The only way to rid herself of the powers would be to kill the person who wronged her. In the comic book continuity Siobhan is known as the Silver Banshee, which is the same name she adopted in this episode.

questions.text: Flash and Supergirl raced off to a warehouse. Who got there first?
questions.explanation:
Supergirl & Kara.

	She bragged to Barry about it. He then told her that he went around the block to check the perimeter first, so he "let" her get there first.

questions.text: Did a villain attack Cat in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Livewire returned with Silver Banshee to the CatCo headquarters and assaulted her just outside of her office. While they were there Banshee blasted Winn, and Livewire hit James Olsen with a shot of electricity. They kidnapped Cat and used her as bait to get to the heroes.

questions.text: Who stepped in to help Supergirl best a villain after The Flash was incapacitated?
questions.explanation:
National City Firefighters.

	The Firefighters stepped in and blasted both Livewire and Silver Banshee with water. They turned to Supergirl and told her that it was time they helped her for a change.  Their help signaled a change in public perception for Supergirl. She had tarnished her reputation several episodes earlier when she was dosed with red Kryptonite.
